artist: Designer: Sonia Delaunay-Terk; Author: Jacques Damase; Publisher: Editions de la Galerie Motte, Paris
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: 11 brightly-colored geometric stenciled designs interspersed with text in black; housed in blue cloth clamshell box

21 x 30 1/8 in. (53.34 x 76.52 cm) (sheet, each, unfolded)
21 7/8 x 15 7/8 x 1 7/8 in. (55.56 x 40.32 x 4.76 cm) (closed, box)

medium: Color pochoirs (watercolor) and letterpress, housed in blue-linen covered portfolio
provenance: (Black Sun Books, New York); sold to MIA, 2004.
signed: on justification page, in blue ink: [Jacques Damase] and [Sonia Delaunay]
text: When Sonia Delaunay met poet-publisher Jacques Damase in 1964, she discovered the kindred spirit she had missed all her life. Their book collaboration shows they were indeed on the same page: Her trademark curved and straight lines match the bold insistence of Damase's text. He extols the magical power of art, which, Delaunay believed, had its essence in the internal rhythms expressed by contrasting colors.
title: Rythmes-Couleurs (Rhythms-Colors)
